page.title: 17FARMING
page.content: The area studied was made up of a vast area of farmland with some woodland and little housing. Some of the farms studied show this area to be important for arable farms growing large fields of wheat and barley with other crops like oil-seed rape, potatoes, peas and sugar-beet. The farms studied included Lamb Farm, Elm Farm, Park Farm, Earls Hall, and Frowick Hall. All were arable farms some of which had little livestock. The Turkey Farm was the only real place which you could say was important for animals. The farms were all quite big with large fieds and had areas of woodland and copse breaking up the landscape which was either flat or gently roling. When we studied the farms we saw lots of machinery in the sheds. Some of the barns and sheds were new but many old buildings remained.
